description:
Through nova's use of python-glanceclient it stacktraces on a 403 error for "Forbidden to update deleted image."

2013-08-08 19:32:41.298 20079 DEBUG glanceclient.common.http [-] 
HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden
date: Thu, 08 Aug 2013 19:32:41 GMT
content-length: 54
content-type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
x-openstack-request-id: req-66289b77-f291-4911-8e15-5b978aae99cc

403 Forbidden

Forbidden to update deleted image.

title: python-glanceclient should not stack trace on a 'Forbidden to update deleted image.'

comments.content:
Through nova's use of python-glanceclient it stacktraces on a 403 error for "Forbidden to update deleted image."

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content:
Don't see it on command line (see below), but I do see a stack trace when testing API via shell: API >>> glance = Client('1', endpoint="http://127.0.0.1:9292", token="34be315e6b8d4c08b6b25978d2b3193a") >>> image = glance.images.get("ff58036d-248b-4780-ae14-7a1a85d17d28") >>> print image.status deleted >>> image.update(properties={'hello':'world'}) No handlers could be found for logger "glanceclient.common.http" Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "/opt/stack/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/v1/images.py", line 49, in update self.manager.update(self, **fields) File "/opt/stack/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/v1/images.py", line 329, in update resp, body = self.client.put(url, headers=hdrs, data=image_data) File "/opt/stack/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/common/http.py", line 259, in put return self._request('PUT', url, **kwargs) File "/opt/stack/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/common/http.py", line 221, in _request raise exc.from_response(resp, resp.content) glanceclient.exc.HTTPForbidden: 403 Forbidden

403 Forbidden

Forbidden to update deleted image.

(HTTP 403) CLI ttripp@ubuntu:/opt/stack/glance$ glance image-update --property hello=world ff58036d-248b-4780-ae14-7a1a85d17d28 Request returned failure status 403. 403 Forbidden

403 Forbidden

Forbidden to update deleted image.

(HTTP 403) API with undeleted image: >>> image = glance.images.get("8d5869d6-79b9-4617-ad08-48223752eae0") >>> print image.status active >>> image.update(properties={'hello':'world'})
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~travis-tripp

comments.content: This has been inactive for long time. I think we need to re-verify if this actually is the behavior still.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jokke

comments.content: Just replicated what Travis did when testing the API via the shell, it's still an issue.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~domhnall-walsh

comments.content:
This is not bug in glanceclient but bug in nova not catching the exception from glanceclient:

devstack-02 :: ~/python-glanceclient ‹master› % tools/with_venv.sh python                                                                              2 ↵
venv develop-inst-nodeps: /home/ubuntu/python-glanceclient
venv runtests: commands[0] | python
Python 2.7.3 (default, Dec 18 2014, 19:10:20)
[GCC 4.6.3] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from glanceclient import client
>>> cl = client.Client(1, endpoint="http://localhost:9292", token="<MYTOKEN>")
>>> image = cl.images.get("a95009af-8bf4-4a38-8d0d-1f795d5f93bf")
>>> try:
...     image.update(properties={'hello':'world'})
... except Exception as e:
...     print e
...
403 Forbidden: Forbidden to update deleted image. (HTTP 403)
>>>
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jokke

comments.content: There are no long active logs for this, do we have more recent logs that can be referenced?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: glance throwing exceptions for not found has always been very questionable behavior.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: Sean, this issue relates to Forbidden status codes, not Not Found. It's quite reasonable to raise an exception on a forbidden error.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~icordasc

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
